word:
You have so long cherished little habits of concealment (especially from your dear father), so long retreated from openness and candor, that you have 


                                    -176- 

become habitually secretive, even when there is often no inducement to be so. This makes you unsatisfactory, unstable, and insincere in character. Your habit of excusing and justifying yourself is often contrary to your conviction of truth. Every act of this kind is doing much toward forming your character. . . .
